statement.p: Consider the function \displaystyle{f{{\left({x},{y}\right)}}}={4}{y}-{x}-{5}{x}^{{3}}. Suppose you are standing on the surface at the point where \displaystyle{x}={3}, \displaystyle{y}={2}. If you start to move on the surface parallel to the \displaystyle{x}-axis in the direction of increasing \displaystyle{x}, does your height increase or decrease?
